Models¶

homeyess/website/models.py

class website.models.JobPost(*args, **kwargs)¶

Model to store information about a job post

Parameters

  • company (User) – the company that made the post

  • created (Date) – the date the post was created

  • last_edited (Date) – the date the post was last edited

  • location (CharField / string) – the location of the job (city, county, etc.)

  • wage (CharField / string) – how much the job will pay (can be hourly, salary, etc.)

  • hours (CharField / string) – the time commitment of the job

  • job_title (CharField / string) – the title of the job (e.g. janitor)

  • short_summary (CharField / string) – a short summary of the job description

  • description (Text / string) – the job description (should include instruction to apply)

exception DoesNotExist¶
exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶
class website.models.Profile(*args, **kwargs)¶

Model to store information about a user

Parameters

  • user (User) – the authentication object containing username, password, email (optional), first / last name

  • phone ((optional) CharField / string) – the user’s phone number

  • user_type (UserType) – the type of user (volunteer, homeless, company)

  • car_plate ((optional) CharField / string) – the license plate number of the volunteer’s car (only required for volunteer)

  • car_make ((optional) CharField / string) – the make of the volunteer’s car (only required for volunteer)

  • car_model ((optional) CharField / string) – the model of the volunteer’s car (only required for volunteer)

  • total_volunteer_minutes (int) – the total amount of time a volunteer has volunteered

  • home_address (CharField / string) – home address (only required for volunteer)

exception DoesNotExist¶
exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶
class UserType¶

Enum to represent types of users: Volunteer, Homeless, Company

class website.models.Ride(*args, **kwargs)¶

Model to store information about a ride request. Contains start / end time and location, the homeless person, and a volunteer if the ride has already been confirmed. Note that the object should be created when a ride request is made and altered when the request is updated (by homeless) or confirmed (by user).

Parameters

  • homeless (User) – the user who requested the ride

  • volunteer ((optional) User) – the user who volunteered to give the ride

  • interview_datetime (DateTime) – the date and time of the interview

  • interview_duration (int) – the time in minutes that the interview should last

  • interview_address (CharField / string) – the address of the interview

  • interview_company (CharField / string) – the company hosting the interview

  • start_datetime (DateTime) – the time the volunteer leaves their house

  • pickup_datetime (DateTime) – the date and time the homeless person should be picked up for their interview

  • end_datetime (DateTime) – the time the volunteer arrives back at their house

exception DoesNotExist¶
exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Ride Utility Functions¶

website.ride_utils.filterQuerySet(rides, start_datetime, end_datetime, max_range, v_start)¶

Filters a list of rides given filters

Parameters

  • rides (iterable of Rides) – the rides to filter

  • start_datetime ((optional) datetime) – the time the volunteer can start driving

  • end_datetime ((optional) datetime) – the time the volunteer must be done driving

  • max_range ((optional) int) – the max in miles the volunteer is willing to drive

  • v_start (string) – home address of volunteer

Returns

the list of rides that obeys the filters

Return type

iterable of Rides

website.ride_utils.getDistance(vec)¶

gets the total distance from a timedistance vector

Parameters

vec (vector where each element is a tuple of form (time in minutes, distance in miles)) – the timedistance vector

Returns

total distance in miles

Return type

int

website.ride_utils.getRideDict(ride)¶

converts ride to a dictionary to use in the templates

Parameters

ride (Ride) – the ride

Returns

dictionary version of the ride with extra fields (d: distance, sd: start_datetime, ed: end_datetime, total_time, pickup_location, pickup_address)

Return type

dict

website.ride_utils.getTimeDistanceVector(v_start, hp_start, interview_location, interview_duration)¶

Gets a time and distance information for the ride

Parameters

  • v_start (string) – home address of volunteer

  • hp_start (string) – pickup address of homeless person

  • interview_location (string) – address of interview

  • interview_duration (int) – how long the interveriw will last (minutes)

Returns

Return type

vector where each element is a tuple (minutes, miles) Elements in order are: volunteer -> homeless pickup, pickup -> interview, (interview_duration, 0), interview -> pickup, pickup -> volunteer home

website.ride_utils.getTimeDistanceVectors(rides, v_start)¶

gets time and distance information for all rides concurrently

Parameters

  • rides (iterable of rides) – rides to get timedistance vectors for

  • v_start (string) – home address of volunteer

Returns

vector of timedistance vectors in same order as the rides

Type

vector of timedistance vectors

website.ride_utils.getTimeString(mins)¶

Generates time string

Parameters

mins (int) – the number of minutes

Returns

time string of form ‘x hr y min’ (hrs or mins if plural)

Return type

string

website.ride_utils.getTimes(vec, interview_datetime)¶

gets the time information from a timedistance vector

Parameters

vec (vector where each element is a tuple of form (time in minutes, distance in miles)) – the timedistance vector

Returns

start_datetime (when volunteer leaves house), pickup_datetime (when volunteer picks up homeless), end_datetime (when volunteer arrives back at their house), total_time_string (total amount of time as a formatted string)

Return type

int, int, int, str

Job Utility Functions¶

website.job_utils.filterQuerySet(jobs, location, job_title)¶

Filters the list of jobs based on location and job title specified

Parameters

  • jobs (list) – The list of all jobs we are filtering

  • location ((optional) string) – A location used to filter certain jobs

  • job_title ((optional) string) – Job title provided by user to filter certain jobs

Returns

The list of all jobs that were found based on the filter

Return type

list
